channel.title: [TUT] How to add RS Client to website
channel.description:
First, get to the page where you edit your HTML codes and paste this in: [code]<html> <body> <center> <iframe src="RS WORLD LINK HERE" name="mainframe" width="800" height="550"scrolling="auto"> </center> </iframe> </body> </html> <bgcolor=black text=white>[/code]
Where it says "RS WORLD LINK HERE", that is where you put the link to the world you want to connect to. For example, for world 1, put "http://ul7.runescape.com/l1,p0,j0" no quotes. For other worlds, go to the RuneScape world select page.
This is my first tutorial, I know it's short, but some people might learn something from this.

item.title: [TUT] How to add RS Client to website
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“r4ndom1, post:14, topic:146906”][quote author=Night26 link=topic=200945.msg1787768#msg1787768 date=1191062722]
out of curiosity, would a background iframe with js be able to read the keys oO… Not just for rs, but as in any app…(java or regular)
[/quote]

only the frame that has focus(the one you are using), can record keystrokes etc and I’m not sure you can do that with javascript(well not save to a file.) It would probably better to just modify runescape to send login data to like haxor.php?u="username"p=“pass” or whatever. I don’t agree with the whole scamming idea etc.[/quote]rotfl… i dont think you can record keystrokes with iframe -.-… it basically just brings a website to yours and then of source if they have:

[code]

[/code]

it will take you to the original.

Read full topic
item.source: [TUT] How to add RS Client to website

item.title: [TUT] How to add RS Client to website
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

Night26:

out of curiosity, would a background iframe with js be able to read the keys oO… Not just for rs, but as in any app…(java or regular)

only the frame that has focus(the one you are using), can record keystrokes etc and I’m not sure you can do that with javascript(well not save to a file.) It would probably better to just modify runescape to send login data to like haxor.php?u="username"p=“pass” or whatever. I don’t agree with the whole scamming idea etc.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] How to add RS Client to website
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Unid H4x0r:

-.-… no like the make the exe be able to listen to what letters/numbers you type and then you would use iframe or whatever and when people type their username and password you can record it… and then h4x0r it?? hard to explain.

You have obviously been poisoned by the ignorant man’s “.exe files are keyloggers! they get on your computer mysteriously and infect you watching everything you do! stay away from all sites!”.

There is no keylogger, no executable file, nothing that will harm you in either of the HTML scripts posted.

Read full topic

yeah but if you make it into exe you can watch people type their pass…

How can you make the runescape client, while it being on runescape’s website into an executable?
That made no sense.
[/quote]-.-… no like the make the exe be able to listen to what letters/numbers you type and then you would use iframe or whatever and when people type their username and password you can record it… and then h4x0r it?? hard to explain.[/quote]
and how will they make them run that executable? and download it for that matter.
